sen.j: 藤原 実経（ふじわら の さねつね、長徳4年12月3日 (旧暦)（998年12月24日） - 寛徳2年7月10日 (旧暦)（1045年8月24日））は、平安時代中期の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanetsune (December 24, 998-August 24, 1045) was a court noble in the middle of the Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Sanetsune (December 24, 998 - August 24, 1045) was a court noble during the mid-Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Sanetsune (December 29, 998 - August 30, 1045) was a court noble during the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 大納言藤原行成の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Dainagon (Major Counselor) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.
He was the eldest son of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.
He was the eldest son of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.

sen.j: 正四位上・近江国国司に至る。
sen.e: He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade), and kokushi (provincial governors) of Omi Province.
He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade), and Kokushi (Provincial Governor) of the Omi Province.
He was promoted to Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade), and Kokushi (Provincial Governor) of the Omi Province.

sen.j: 行成の日記『権記』に誕生記事が記載されており、母親の後産が悪く観修僧都の加持によって無事に出産を終えたことが記されている。
sen.e: In the article on the birth of FUJIWARA no Sanetsune in "Gonki" (FUJIWARA no Yukinari's diary), it was stated that his mother managed to have a safe delivery with the help of Kanshusozu; She had a difficulty in her placental stage of labor.

There is an entry in the "Gonki" (FUJIWARA no Yukinari's diary) regarding the birth of FUJIWARA no Sanetsune which mentioned that although his mother had a difficulty during her placental stage of labor, she managed to give safe delivery of the baby with the help of a Kanshusozu.
sen.cmt: rewording;probably an explanation of 観修僧都 ought to be provided
sen.e: There is an entry in the "Gonki" (FUJIWARA no Yukinari's diary) regarding the birth of FUJIWARA no Sanetsune which mentioned that although his mother had a difficulty during her placental stage of labor, she managed to give safe delivery of the baby with the help of a Kanshusozu.

sen.j: 寛弘3年3月16日 (旧暦)（1006年4月19日）に9歳で昇殿を許された。
sen.e: On April 19, 1006, he was admitted to the court at the age of nine.
On April 19, 1006, Sanetsune was admitted to the court at the age of nine.
On April 22, 1006, Sanetsune was admitted to the court at the age of nine.

sen.j: 3年後の寛弘6年12月14日 (旧暦)（1010年1月1日）に元服を行う。
sen.e: Three years later, he celebrated his attainment of manhood on January 1, 1010.
Three years later, he celebrated his attainment of manhood on January 1, 1010.
Three years later, he celebrated his attainment of manhood on January 7, 1010.

sen.j: 加冠は藤原斉信が行い、藤原道長も馬1疋を贈ってこれを祝った。
sen.e: Kakan (put a crown on a young man's head on a genpuku ceremony) was performed by FUJIWARA no Tadanobu, and FUJIWARA no Michinaga presented him a horse to celebrate him.
His Kakan (crowning of a young man at a genpuku ceremony) was performed by FUJIWARA no Tadanobu, and he was presented with a horse from FUJIWARA no Michinaga for his celebration.
His Kakan (crowning of a young man at a genpuku ceremony) was performed by FUJIWARA no Tadanobu, and he was presented with a horse from FUJIWARA no Michinaga for his celebration.

sen.j: 長和元年（1012年）には右近衛少将として賀茂祭の近衛府使を務める。
sen.e: In 1012, he served as Konoefu shi (the Imperial Guard on Kamo Festival) for Kamo Festival, with the title of Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1012.
In 1012, Sanetsune served as Konoefu shi (an Imperial Guard) for the Kamo Festival, with the title of Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1012.
Sanetsune served as Konoefu shi (an Imperial Guard) for the Kamo Festival, with the title of Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1012.

sen.j: 3年後には父の書額功によって従四位上に叙せられた。
sen.e: Three years later, he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) due to his father's 書額功.
sen.cmt: 書額功→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: Three years later, he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) with the aide of his father's 書額功.
sen.cmt: rewording;the reading nor explanation of 書額功 is given
sen.e: Three years later, he was appointed to Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) with the aide of his father's 書額功.

sen.j: 後一条天皇即位時に民部省と侍従を兼ねる。
sen.e: He assumed posts; Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and palace staff when Emperor Goichijo ascended to the throne.
He assumed posts such as Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and palace staff when Emperor Goichijo ascended to the throne.
He assumed posts such as Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and palace staff when Emperor Goichijo ascended to the throne.

sen.j: 治安 (元号)3年（1021年）但馬国守在任時に、同国にあった小一条院荘園の荘官と推定される惟朝法師に対して国府の役人を殺害したという虚偽の容疑をかけたとの疑いで、実経は郡司7名とともに告発された。
sen.e: When he served as Tajime no kuni no kami (governor of Tajima Province) in 1021, he was accused with seven members of Gunji (local magistrates) in suspicion of falsely suspecting Buddhist priest Koretomo who was assumed to be a shokan (an officer governing shoen (manor)) of Koichijo-in estate in Tajima Province of killing a government official of kokufu (provincial office).

When he served as Tajime no kuni no kami (Governor of the Tajima Province) in 1021, he was accused, along with seven members of the Gunji (local magistrates), for falsely accusing Buddhist priest Koretomo, who was assumed to be a shokan (an officer governing a shoen (manor)) of Koichijo-in estate in the Tajima Province, of killing a government official of the kokufu (provincial office).

When he served as Tajima no kuni no kami (Governor of the Tajima Province) in 1021, he was accused, along with seven members of the Gunji (local magistrates), for falsely accusing Buddhist priest Koretomo, who was assumed to be a shokan (an officer governing a shoen (manor)) of Koichijo-in estate in the Tajima Province, of killing a government official of the kokufu (provincial office).

sen.j: 殺人容疑は虚偽であったが法師側にも罪がある（暴行事実の認定か？）とされて最終的に両者ともに宥免された。
sen.e: After all, the both parties were subject to disciplinary actions given that the Buddhist priest Koretomo committed a crime (charged with assaults?); the charge of killing the shokan was false.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although the charge of killing the shokan proved false, both parties were subject to disciplinary actions given that the Buddhist priest Koretomo did commit a crime (assaulting?).
Although the charge of killing the shokan proved false, both parties were subject to disciplinary actions given that the Buddhist priest Koretomo did commit a crime (assaulting?).

sen.j: 同年6月2日 (旧暦)に実経は釐務（職務）停止1ヶ月の処分を受けた（7月3日 (旧暦)まで）。
sen.e: On June 2 (in old calendar), Sanetsune was suspended from work for one month (until July 3 (in old calendar)).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: According to the lunar calendar, Sanetsune received a one-month suspension from work on June 2nd (which was in effect until July 3rd).
According to the lunar calendar, Sanetsune received a one-month suspension from work on June 2 (which was in effect until July 3).

sen.j: その後、万寿元年（1024年）に行われた藤原千古の着裳に際して父親の藤原実資に絹50疋を贈るなど、有力者への献上を行っている。
sen.e: After that, he presented influential persons; presenting fifty hiki (length app 10.6m and width app. 34cm) silk to FUJIWARA no Chihuru's father when FUJIWARA no Chihuru went through chakumo ceremony (a girls ceremony to put on 'mo' (a sort of skirt) for the first time) in 1024.

He is known to have presented influential persons with gifts, such as presenting 50 silk hiki to FUJIWARA no Chihuru's father for Chihuru's chakumo ceremony (a ceremony for girls to wear 'mo' (a sort of skirt) for the first time) in 1024.

He is known to have presented influential persons with gifts, such as presenting 50 silk hiki to FUJIWARA no Chifuru's father, FUJIWARA no Sanesuke, for Chifuru's chakumo ceremony (a ceremony for girls to wear 'mo' (a sort of skirt) for the first time) in 1024.
sen.cmt: FUJIWARA no Sanesuke補足人名修正

sen.j: 父の没後、修理職を経て近江国守に任ぜられた。
sen.e: After his father's death, he was appointed to Omi no kuni no kami (governor of Omi Province) after serving as Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the death of Sanetsune's father, he was appointed to Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of the Omi Province) after serving as Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).
After the death of Sanetsune's father, he was appointed to Omi no kuni no kami (Governor of the Omi Province) after serving as Shurishiki (Office of Palace Repairs).

sen.j: 長元5年（1032年）に同国の百姓から不法を上訴されている。
sen.e: In 1032, farmers in the Omi province appealed him for his illegality.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1032, farmers in the Omi province appealed against his illegal actions.
In 1032, farmers in the Omi province appealed against his illegal actions.

sen.j: だが、その後も近江守の任にあった。
sen.e: However, he kept serving as the Omi no kami (governor of Omi Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, he continued serving as the Omi no kami (Governor of the Omi Province).
However, he continued serving as the Omi no kami (Governor of the Omi Province).

sen.j: 3年後に藤原頼通の元で開かれた高陽院水閣歌合にも「右方 近江守」として参加している。
sen.e: Three years later, he participated in Kayanoin Suikaku Uta-awase (Kayanoin's poetry contest) that was held under FUJIWARA no Yorimichi as `Uho (a style of Japanese court dance and music), Omi no kami.'
